Event.name: Try_defendant
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Defendant</fen> is tried by a <fen>Jury</fen> or <fen>Judge</fen> in a <fen>Court</fen> for <fen>Charges</fen>. This frame perspectivalizes the general Trial frame.
<ex><fex name="Governing_authority">The state</fex> will <t>try</t> <fex name="Defendant">him</fex> <fex name="Charges">for fraud</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Judge
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Judge</fen> heads the <fen>Court</fen> where the case is tried. An expression referring to the <fen>Court</fen> may also stand in for the <fen>Judge</fen>. <ex><fex name="Judge">Judge Murphy</fex> will <t>try</t> the defendant for murder.</ex> <ex><fex name="Judge">The court</fex> is currently <t>trying</t> several South American militants on charges of vehicular manslaughter.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Court
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Court</fen> in which a case is tried.</def-root>

Arg.name: Defendant
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Defendant</fen> is being tried for the <fen>Charges</fen> in <fen>Court</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Jury
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the people who are charged by the <fen>Court</fen> to listen to the testimony, evidence, and arguments, and come to a consensus about the guilt or innocence of the <fen>Defendant</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the case is tried.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the case is tried.</def-root>

Arg.name: Charges
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Charges</fen> brought against the <fen>Defendant</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Governing_authority
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Defendant</fen> is tried under the laws of the <fen>Governing_authority</fen>. <ex><fex name="GA">The United States</fex> will <t>try</t> the accused bomber in a federal courthouse.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> of the trial of the <fen>Defendant</fen>. <ex>Thomas Klein was <t>tried</t> <fex name="Manner">in absentia</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: try.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: subject (someone) to trial, or investigate and decide (a case or issue) in a formal trial.
